tutorial.title: Stories for Kids
tutorial.descriptionContent: Use your flexbox knowledge to style a stories page

executableContent.instructions:
Let's practice using Flexbox by creating a responsive website that shares familiar childhood stories.

We already have some HTML code and styles added to our project, but we want to make sure that our design is visible across all devices and browsers. 

To accomplish this, we'll use Flexbox to make the main webpage section shrink and grow responsively. For now, you can simply look through the code to familiarize yourself with it. Note we won't be changing the HTML at all in this project.

Stories for Kids

Home
Bedtime

Poems

A long time ago in a land far away, in the Kingdom of Tazanah, there used to be a family of three.

One early morning when the birds were chirping and singing sweetly the father of the family woke up and went to open the gate.

files.name: style.css

executableContent.instructions:
First, let's code the flex properties that control how flex items grow across the main axis by using `flex-grow`.

1. Set the default property value for `flex-grow` within the `.menu` selector on our stylesheet.
2. Add `flex-grow` within the `.content` selector and give it a value that gives it more space than the default value.

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Remember that the default property value for `flex-grow` is `0`.

executableContent.instructions:
We'll then add the property `flex-shrink` to shrink the menu and the content sections responsively, or as the screen size gets smaller.

1. Set `flex-shrink` within the `menu` selector to `0`.
2. Set `flex-shrink` within the `content` selector to its default value.

hints.title: Hint
hints.content: Remember that the default value for `flex-shrink` is 1. Its syntax looks like this: `flex-shrink: <shrink-value>;`

executableContent.instructions:
The `flex-basis` property sets the initial value of a flex item and provides a basis for the flex item to grow or shrink from. 

Next, let's use the `flex-basis` property to set the initial value for the menu and content sections. 

1. Set the `flex-basis` property within the `.menu` selector to `80px`.
2. Set the `flex-basis` property within the `.content` selector to `200px`.

executableContent.instructions:
For this project, we want to use the least amount of code possible. To accomplish this, let's replace our current `flex-grow`, `flex-shrink`, and `flex-basis` properties with `flex` shorthand properties that address all of our changes in one line.

1. Remove the `flex-shrink`, `flex-grow`, and `flex-basis` properties from the `menu` selector and replace them with the `flex` shorthand property with its corresponding values. 
2. Remove the `flex-shrink`, `flex-grow`, and `flex-basis` properties from the `content` selector and replace them with the `flex` shorthand property with its corresponding values.
